class.name: SendFailedNotification
class.javadoc:
Notification emitted when a send failed notification has been received.

A send failed notification indicates that a message cannot be delivered. Typically this is because the association has been shutdown with unsent data in the socket output buffer, or in the case of a {@link SctpMultiChannel}the association failed to setup. 1.7
Initializes a new instance of this class.

Returns the association that this notification is applicable to.
The association that failed to send, or {@code null} if there is no association, that is, the notification follows a{@linkplain com.sun.nio.sctp.AssociationChangeNotification.AssocChangeEvent#CANT_START}

Returns the address.
The peer primary address of the association or the address that the message was sent to

Returns the data that was to be sent.
The user data. The buffers position will be {@code 0} and its limit will be set to the end of the data.

Returns the error code.

The errorCode gives the reason why the send failed, and if set, will be a SCTP protocol error code as defined in RFC2960 section 3.3.10 The error code

Returns the stream number that the messge was to be sent on.
The stream number
